string: £156,000,000 contract to Tory councillor Steve Dechan for PPE imports.
Up to £1,100,000,000 in Government PPE Contracts Awarded to Firms Linked to Religious Sect
£819,000 (3x contracts) to Paul Stephenson of Hanbury Strategy for polling, focus groups and strategy. Stephenson is a former Tory adviser and Cumming's ally.
Go-between paid £21,000,000 in taxpayer funds for NHS PPE
£347,000,000 contract (£500,000,000 total) given to NI-based Randox, who had to recall 750,000 contaminated testing kits. No other company was allowed to bid.

£154,000,000 (4x contracts) to David Meller of Meller Designs for hand sanitiser and face masks. Meller donated £65,000 to the Conservative Party, is a former non-executive board member of the Department of Education, and was the finance chair for Micheal Gove's Conservative leadership campaign.
£1,000,000 contract given to friend of Cumming's for public opinion surveys and strategic advice.
3x contracts to PA Consulting Services Ltd.
2x £203,000,000 contacts given to Andrew Page's PPE Medpro Ltd.
£276,000,000 contract given to former Tory councillors firm P14 Medical for face shields.
£108,000,000 to Pestfix, a pest control company with 16 members of staff and assets worth around £18,000.
